sentences.english: The aggressors could not get supplies or reinforcements through because of the guerrilla warfare.
sentences.chinese: 由于游击战的牵制，侵略者无法输送给养或援兵。

sentences.english: In the middle of the day Murat sent his adjutant to Napoleon with a request for reinforcements.
sentences.chinese: 中午，缪拉派他的副官到拿破仑那儿请求援兵。

sentences.english: The general's hopes of victory were dashed when enemy reinforcements arrived.
sentences.chinese: 敌人援兵到达时，将军胜利的希望破灭了。

sentences.english: That is the only road on which they can bring up reinforcements.
sentences.chinese: 他们要把援兵开赴前线，必须走这条公路。

sentences.english: The soldiers tried to keep the attacking enemy in check until help came.
sentences.chinese: 战士们设法牵制住敌人，等待援兵到来。

sentences.english: He'd be a great addition to either squad.
sentences.chinese: 他将会是一个极好的援兵。

sentences.english: He had inhaled some of it, and lost consciousness even as help arrived.
sentences.chinese: 他吸入了一些毒气，直到援兵赶到时还昏迷不醒。

sentences.english: The commander sent out troops to stop the enemy's backup troops.
sentences.chinese: 司令员派出部队阻遏敌人的援兵。

sentences.english: Need not your tube, cooked it's still early, my help is fast approaching.
sentences.chinese: 不用你管，要熟还早着呢，我的援兵就快到了。

definition: to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
to come to the aid of/to save/to rescue from danger/to relieve
